title: CTRL0000061466 - Transcribed Interview of Patrick MacDonnell, (April 4, 2022)

data.text: JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL,
The deposition in the above matter was held, via Webex, commencing at 10:00
For the SELECT COMMITTEE TO INVESTIGATE
THE JANUARY 6TH ATTACK ON THE U.S. CAPITOL:
This is a deposition of Patrick MacDonnell conducted by the House Select
Committee to Investigate the January 6 Attack on the United States Capitol pursuant to
Mr. MacDonnell, please state your full name and spell your last name for the
And would you please raise your right hand to be sworn.
Do you solemnly declare and affirm under the penalty of perjury that the
testimony you are about to give will be truth, the whole truth, and nothing but the truth?
So this will be a staff-led deposition, and members, of course, may
So we'll follow the House deposition rules that we've provided to your counsel
senior investigative counsel, a n d -

I'm an investigative counsel with the select committee.
In the room with me today are
choose to ask questions if they join.
Patrick Pierson MacDonnell, last name M-a-c-D-o-n-n-e-1-1.
Under the House deposition rules, you are permitted to have an attorney

This is Mark Lytle, L-y-t-1-e, with Nixon Peabody, and also with us
that's actually off camera is Robert McManigal, M-c-M-a-n-i-g-a-1.
Under the House deposition rules, neither committee members nor staff may

Before we begin, though, I would like to describe a few ground rules.
There's an official reporter transcribing the record of this deposition.
reporter also is joining us by Webex.
before you begin your response, and we will try to wait until your response is complete

And if you do not know the
And, logistically, please let us know if you need any breaks or would like to discuss
Throughout the deposition, we will be directing your attention to exhibits, which
will be displayed on the screen.

providing false information could result in criminal penalties, to include for perjury and/or

So we're just going to get started with a couple of background questions.
How old are you, Mr. MacDonnell?
And can you describe your educational background?
I attended the University of Virginia for an undergraduate in political science.
And what year did you graduate?
So what is your current job?
I am a speechwriter and legislative assistant in the U.S. Senate.

I don't recall all of the titles that I held, but I was a -- started as a researcher
and executive assistant I believe was the title.
some point as well and an assistant speechwriter, and at the end of my time, I believe my
title was special assistant to the President and speechwriter.
Then I became a senior researcher at
So were you there for all 4 years of the Trump administration?
For the vast majority, starting in February of 2017 and I believe ending
I was a researcher at the Republican National Committee after graduating

So now we're going to talk a little bit about your --

I reported to -- primarily to Vince Haley and Ross Worthington.
Above them was -- in the office was Stephen Miller.
Mark Meadows, would you say you reported directly to him?
There was a -- the organization of the speechwriting office was a little fluid,
Anyone else that you reported to?
so it's difficult to answer that question.
What do you mean by fluid?
There were two researchers, and due to the fact that I had been a researcher
for a number of years, occasionally I would give them assistance.

occasionally, but I did not report directly to him.
